title: Apple quince crumble (vegan)
intro: Here is a no-butter crumble recipe, perfect for the apple season. I love adding some quinces in the mix, that balance out the sweetness with some acidity.

ingMand: As many apples (for sweetness) and quinces (sourness) as you like

insSteps: Cut the fruit into pieces (you can keep some of the peel for a rustic look).
In a bowl, combine the flour, almond flour, sugar, and oil.
Mix with your fingers or a fork until the mixture resembles coarse breadcrumbs. Add a little water if the mixture is too dry. Do not add more flour. Spread this crumbly mixture over the fruit.
Bake for about 30–35 minutes, until golden brown.
